text: Moores Bridge, also spelled Moors Bridge, is an unincorporated community in Tuscaloosa County, Alabama, United States. Moores Bridge is located along Alabama State Route 171, north-northwest of Tuscaloosa. ==History== Moores Bridge is named for the bridge built by Duncan Taney Moore over the Sipsey River. A post office operated under the name Moores Bridge from 1853 to 1966. ==Notable person== * James Jefferson Mayfield, Associate Justice of the Alabama Supreme Court from 1908 to 1920 ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Tuscaloosa County, Alabama Category:Unincorporated communities in Alabama
title: Moores Bridge, Alabama
